article.headline: New Orleans 82, Ark.-Little Rock 73
article.story: LITTLE ROCK (AP) -- Bo McCalebb's 27 second-half points sparked a comeback by New Orleans to get an 82-73 Sun Belt Conference win Saturday night over Arkansas-Little Rock. The Privateers (8-8, 4-1 SBC) trailed 31-28 at the half and were behind 50-41 with 12:48 left in the game. But then they went on an 11-0 run to take command of the game and defeat the Trojans (8-9, 3-3). McCalebb played only 6 minutes of the first half, scoring just 2 points, but overpowered the defenders after intermission to finish with 29 points. He was also credited with seven assists and six rebounds and went 14-for-15 at the foul line. All five UNO starters scored in double figures, with James Parlow adding 15 points, Jamie McNeilly 12, Ben Elias 11 and Shaun Reynolds 10. Rashad Jones-Jennings led UALR with 17 points and a game-high 13 rebounds. Lekheythan Malone added 14 points, Terrance Akins had 12 and Steven Moore scored 10.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
